SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 28th JULY, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front.
The enemy has retired from the MARNE and at 9 p.m., yesterday the line as reported by the French now runs as follows:- West of MARFAUX - South-East of LA NEUVILLE-AUX-LARRIS - North of CUCHERY - LA MAQUERELLE - PASSY GRIGNY - CHAMPVOISY - VILLARDELLE FARM - thence along the river OURCQ to MOULIN MENARD (South-East Of OULCHY LE CHATEAU). Small detachments are reported to be in FERE-EN-TARDENOIS. Cavalry are being pushed out, and have reached the line BLIGNY - CHAUMUZY - along the road from VILLE-EN-TARDENOIS to VILLERS AGRON - ST GEMMES - LA DEFENSE (North West of CHAMPVOISY). On the rest of the battle front there is no change.
(b) British Front.
There is nothing of special interest to report.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
There is no change in the general situation.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
The Austrians have succeeded in recrossing the river SEMENI at the KUCI BEND (North West of BURAT) where the Italians lost, but subsequently re-gained by counter-attacks, the heights near SUEZEZI. The Austrians also claim to have crossed the river at KALMI, 7 miles further down stream, but the situation at this point is obscure.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
28th July, 1918.
Issued at 12.35 p.m.
For the personal information - of the Minister only.
